definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Peter is a black sheep of his family. He sold his house for drinking.
sentences.chinese: 皮特真是个败家子，卖了房子换酒钱。

sentences.english: You can chalk the drinks up to my account.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把酒钱记到我的帐上。

sentences.english: She says she attributes it to the "beer money" being handed out by BP.
sentences.chinese: 她说可能是英石油给的酒钱太多，大家把身体喝坏了。

sentences.english: Zhou Lijun laughed, dropped the drinks and the card away.
sentences.chinese: 周立军笑了，扔下了酒钱和那张名片就走了。

sentences.english: I've never known him (to) pay for a drink.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没见他付过酒钱。

sentences.english: Please charge the bill to my tab.
sentences.chinese: 请你把酒钱记在我的账上。

sentences.english: They also paid for the liquor.
The waiter made a mistake when he added the wine twice.
sentences.chinese: 服务员错把酒钱多加了一次。

sentences.english: Could you put it one my tab, please?
sentences.chinese: 请把酒钱记在我的帐上好吗？

sentences.english: You call, heads or tails? That will decide who pays for the drinks.
sentences.chinese: 你说，是正面还是反面？那将决定谁付酒钱。

sentences.english: Let's go halves in buying the wine.

definition: room charge in a hotel/accommodation expenses
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
